cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast today, then expected to turn west and crawl just offshore/along the Louisiana coast toward the TX-LA border through late Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch discontinued; no active watches west of Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the MS/AL border; Storm Surge Warning Morgan City, LA to Ocean Springs, MS
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana shoreline, Mississippi coast and eventually the upper TX coast (including Sabine Pass/Port Arthur–Beaumont area) as the weakening system drifts west
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (3–5 inch totals forecast with isolated higher amounts)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (no surge warning for upper TX coast, expected <2 ft at Sabine Pass)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty tropical-storm-force winds possible late Tuesday night into Wednesday (peak 35–45 mph gusts).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation around Sabine Pass possible, generally 1–2 ft above ground.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Tuesday–Wednesday could lead to localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A brief tornado cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands.
